hints.content:
The ratio of $\blueD{\text{students who wish they had x-ray vision}}$ to $\maroonD{\text{all students}}$ is a $\blueD{\text{part}}$ to $\maroonD{\text{whole}}$ ratio.

To see if this statement is true, we need to find the $\maroonD{\text{total}}$ number of students:

$8 + 10 + 6 + 12 = \maroonD{36}$

There are a total of $\maroonD{36}$ students.

The ratio of $\blueD{\text{students who wish they had x-ray vision}}$ to $\maroonD{\text{all students}}$ is $\blueD6:\maroonD{36}$.

We can create an equivalent ratio by $\greenD{\text{dividing by 6}}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0c7fd7a7559318a38186b52170fa762b0faa36cb)


Yes, the ratio of students who wish they had x-ray vision to all students is $1:6$!

The ratio of $\blueD{\text{students who wish they could fly}}$ to $\maroonD{\text{all students}}$ is $\blueD8:\maroonD{36}$.

We can create an equivalent ratio by $\greenD{\text{dividing by 4}}$.

![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/4891271e8700aa0e39974dc5266762b02f31d2c2)


Yes, the ratio of students who wish they could fly to all students is $2:9$!
The true statements are 'The ratio of students who wish they had x-ray vision to all students is $1:6$' and 'For every $2$ students who wish they could fly there are  $9$ total students.'
